text: making lunch on what is normally the
busiest day of the season this is the
kitchen at one of gobbles most popular
French restaurants the cooks have been
specially trained by a chef from Paris
and the food here has made it a major
draw for the city's expat population but
today there is one slight problem there
is no one to serve try dis Christmas we
don't have reservation we don't have a
summer and we will make the food we have
the meaning of the Christmas up to now
we don't have customer we didn't have a
reservation last January a Taliban
attack on a Lebanese restaurant left 21
people dead more than a dozen foreigners
among them including UN officials since
then most restaurants catering to
Westerners have shut down and security
fears are keeping them away from the few
that remain it's not just a food
business that's hurting
gobbles real estate boom fueled by the
flood of aid workers diplomats and
contractors who came here over the past
10 years
his slowing down
this large houses in one of cobbles most
exclusive neighborhoods I've just been
inside it of several bedrooms a
fireplace very very modern now it was
rented by a Western company a few months
ago who were paying four and a half
thousand dollars a month in rent it's
been on the rental market now but there
are no takers and the estate agent who's
showing me around says he has sixty
other similar homes and they're all
empty and invariably those have been hit
hardest are the ones who are most
vulnerable ordinary Afghans the market
selling the country's famed carpets are
quiet once fetching several hundred
dollars apiece it's been months since
anyone here has sold any horrible Colin
Taliban Ashley clear me dammit - adios -
also in the last year I've hardly sold
any carpets I don't have enough money to
pay the rent for my shop or even support
my family therapy Molly a sect Arabs are
worried the last decade had raised hope
among Afghans of peace and prosperity
but now the Westerners are leaving and
as winter sets in it's beginning to look
bleak Sanja Majumdar BBC news Kabul
